title: API not working with BeamNG.drive
body:
The documentation mentions that BeamNGpy should have basic support for BeamNG.drive:

> The regular Steam release of BeamNG.drive is compatible to an extent as well. Certain sensors like the simulated LiDAR or camera will not work, but most of the functions that are not exclusive to a Tech build will likely work.

But I cannot get it to work. It seems that it fails to load the util_researchGE extension and with that the game will not respond on the API port 64256. I tried to follow earlier reported (now closed) issues on how to manually set up a workspace, but it does not seem to work for me. Is that the reason why the util_researchGE extension does not work? What am I missing?

BeamNG.drive console output:
000.623|I|Paths|User path: C:\Users\quaid\AppData\Local\BeamNG.drive\0.24\
002.941|I|GELua.core_input_bindings.bindings|Controller connected: XBox Controller 1 (xinput0/0xXIDevice)
002.977|I|GELua.print|*************LightRayPostFX 2 set
002.982|I|GELua.print|********PostFXSSAOGeneralEnabled 2 set
003.033|I|reloadLanguages|Switched from '' language to 'en-US' (as fallback, after trying 'sv-SE')
003.382|W|GELua.core_levels.|info.json missing: /levels/GridMap/info.json
003.383|E|GELua.core_levels.|No entry point for level found: /levels/GridMap. Ignoring level.
003.733|E|GELua.extensions|extension unavailable: "util_researchGE" at location: "util/researchGE"


Python output:
python .\west_coast_random.py
2022-04-15 01:20:39,475 |INFO     |beamngpy                      |Started BeamNGpy logging.
2022-04-15 01:20:39,475 |WARNING  |py.warnings                   |C:\Users\quaid\AppData\Local\Packages\PythonSoftwareFoundation.Python.3.10_qbz5n2kfra8p0\LocalCache\local-packages\Python310\site-packages\beamngpy\beamng.py:69: DeprecationWarning: The use of `beamng.setup_logging` is deprecated and will be removed in future versions. Use `beamngcommon.set_up_simple_logging` or `beamngcommon.config_logging` instead.
  create_warning(warn_msg, DeprecationWarning)

Use `beamngcommon.set_up_simple_logging` or `beamngcommon.config_logging` instead.
  create_warning(warn_msg, DeprecationWarning)
